Class Guard

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Character
      • logic.Guard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Drunken, Rookie, Suspicious

    public abstract class Guard
extends Character
    Guard, the first level's enemy

    • Field Detail

      • movements

        protected int[][] movements
        The Guard's pre-determined set of movements. Depending on the Guard type, they can be done in a reverse order

      • movementIndex

        protected int movementIndex
        Holds the index to the Guard's next movement in his routine

    • Constructor Detail

      • Guard

        public Guard(int startX,
             int startY)
        Constructor. Initializes with default representation 'G' and movementIndex at 0
        Parameters:
        startX - Guard's initial x-axis position
        startY - Guard's initial y-axis position
        See Also:
        movementIndex

    • Method Detail

      • hasCaughtHero

        public boolean hasCaughtHero(int heroX,
                             int heroY)
        Checks if Guard has caught the Hero.
        Parameters:
        heroX - Hero's x-axis position
        heroY - Hero's y-axis position
        Returns:
        true if Guard is not asleep and is near Hero, false otherwise
        See Also:
        isNearHero

      • getMovIndex

        public int getMovIndex()
        Gets the Guard's movement index to check his next movement. Used mainly for Unit testing
        Returns:
        Guard's movementIndex
        See Also:
        movementIndex

      • updatePosition

        public abstract void updatePosition()
        Updates the Guard's position. Different for each type of Guard as each one has a different behavior
